property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Typical of male Advosze, Bom Vimdin despises those of his own species. Pessimistic and territorial, he is a lone smuggler who prefers to work for corrupt officials.

property.name: GameText
property.value: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. Whenever you deploy a weapon or device from hand at same location, activate 1 Force as a 'kickback.' Limit of one Advosze per location.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Imperial pilots often target astromech aboard Rebel starfighters in an attempt to prevent hyper-escapes. Scarcity of undamaged astromechs can delay starfighter deployment.

property.name: GameText
property.value: Use 3 Force to deploy on opponent's side of the table. All opponent's starships with an astromech or nav computer icon are deploy +1.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Stormtroopers blasted through the main airlock of the Tantive IV. The Rebel soldiers' attempt to defend the intrusion was no match for the Empire's superior firepower.

property.name: GameText
property.value: Deploy on a captured starship. Your characters present with captured starship may battle opponent's characters aboard it (as if present together at a site). Effect canceled if starship escapes or is stolen.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: The light, enclosed shuttle is used for courrier runs to large orbiting transports.

property.name: FirstBox
property.value: SHUTTLE VEHICLE

property.name: GameText
property.value: May carry 3 passengers. Permanent pilot aboard provides ability of 1. May move as a 'react'. * Landspeed = 3. OR Up to 3 characters may shuttle to or from same site for free.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: TIE fighter flown by DS-61-4 at the Battle of Yavin. Scored a hit on Red 5 during the confrontation.

property.name: FirstBox
property.value: STARFIGHTER: TIE/LN

property.name: SecondBox
property.value: NO HYPERDRIVE

property.name: GameText
property.value: May add 1 pilot. May deploy with a pilot as a 'react' to a battle initiated against a TIE (for free if TIE is Black 2 or 3). Must have pilot aboard to use power or maneuver.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Docking bay security officer. Leader. Honored for bravery aboard the Star Destroyer Thunderflare where he rescued five officers from the wreckage of a shuttle crash.

property.name: GameText
property.value: During your control phase, you may use 2 Force to search through your Reserve Deck and take one Scanning Crew into your hand. Shuffle deck, cut and replace.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Pilots are often reassigned at the last minute for a variety of tactical reasons. Darth Vader ordered DS-61-2 and DS-61-3 to accompany him to the Battle of Yavin.

property.name: GameText
property.value: Use 1 Force to attempt to eliminate a starfighter's permanent pilot. Draw destiny. If destiny >2, deploy on starfighter to remove permanent pilot. May now add 1 pilot. Must have pilot aboard to use power, naneuver or hyperspeed. (Immune to Alter.)

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: GameText
property.value: During your control phase, fire Superlaser as follows: Name The System: Use X Force to target a planet system Death Star is orbiting. You May Fire When Ready: Draw destiny. Stand By: If (destiny+Y-Z)>8, target system is 'blown away' and this card is lost. Otherwise, this card is used and one Death Star Gunner on table is lost (your choice). X=total sites at target. Y=total Death Star sites where opponent has no presence. Z=opponent's choice of X or total sites at one Rebel Base (Yavin 4 or Hoth.)

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: One of the Imperial cruisers that chased the Milennium Falcon from Tatooine. It scanned the Falcon just before Han punched his starship to lightspeed.

property.name: FirstBox
property.value: CAPITAL: IMPERIAL-CLASS STAR DESTROYER

property.name: GameText
property.value: May add 6 pilots, 8 passengers, 2 vehicles and 4 TIEs. Has ship-docking capability. Permanent pilot aboard provides ability of 1. After initiating battle against Falcon, may look at Rebel hand.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Anzati assassin. Cheek-folds hide proboscises which allow him to 'eat the soup' (consume the life Force) of his victims. Smokes t'bac. Currently working for Jabba.

property.name: GameText
property.value: Once per battle, may use 1 Force to 'eat the soup' of (place out of play) one opposing non-droid character lost or forfeited at same site. *Power=1 + ability of all victims whose soup was eaten.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Cocky gunner and bounty hunter. Maintains a residence on Nar Shaddaa, the spaceport moon of the Hutt homeworld. To his companions' delight, he's nearly as good as he boasts.

property.name: GameText
property.value: Adds 3 to power of any starship he pilots. OR If aboard a starship as a passenger, adds 1 to sharship's weapon destiny draws.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Swamp predators require damp and cluttered environments to enhance their camoflage and stealth. 'Something just moved past my leg.'

property.name: GameText
property.value: Deploy on any exterior planet site (except Hoth) or any interior vehicle site. Opponent's Force drains are -1 here. (Immune to Alter when a swamp creature is present.)

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: DarkLocationText
property.value: X=parsec of current position. Must deploy at Parsec 0. Hyperspeed = 1. Immune to Revolution. If this is your starting location, Light side goes first in game.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Most gunners in the Imperial Navy once aspired to be TIE pilots, but lacked sufficient skills to fly starfighters. A few were assigned to the Death Star to man the main artillery.

property.name: GameText
property.value: If on Death Star: Cumulatively adds 2 to total of Commence Primary Ignition. OR During your control phase, may send this gunner to your Used Pile; search your Reserve Deck and take Superlaser into hand. Shuffle, cut and replace.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: 'Why are we still moving towards it?'

property.name: GameText
property.value: Use 2 Force to deploy on Docking Bay 327. At the end of a battle at Death Star system, may target a starship there (except Mon Calamari Star Cruiser) using 2 Force. Draw two destiny. Starship captured if total destiny > armor or maneuver.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: DarkLocationText
property.value: If you control with a leader here, may add 1 to total of Commence Primary Ignition.

property.name: LightLocationText
property.value: If you control, Force drain +1 and may subtract 1 from total of Commence Primary Ignition.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Male Defel from af'El. This species, also known as 'wraiths', is capable of warping light around themselves, becoming difficult to see at dusk.

property.name: GameText
property.value: Under 'nighttime conditions,' may use 1 Force to 'hide' from (not participate in) a battle. While at a site affected by Revolution, opponent must lose 1 Force during your control phase.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: 'Garbage squid' from Vodran's jungles. Changes color to match last meal. When unfed, turns transparent. Eats almost anything. Flexible eyestalk. 7 tentacles. Up to 6 meters long.

property.name: FirstBox
property.value: SWAMP CREATURE

property.name: GameText
property.value: *Ferocity=(power/ferocity of last character or creature eaten) + destiny. Habitat: exterior Dagobah sites, Trash Compactor and Dark Waters.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Imperial pilot nicknamed 'Dark Curse.' Survived assaults against several dissenter worlds including Raltiir and Mon Calamari. Intends to retire after his next combat mission.

property.name: GameText
property.value: Adds 3 to power of any starship he pilots. On Black 4, also draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise. May use 1 Force to search through your Reserve Deck and take one Lone Pilot into your hand. Shuffle, cut and replace.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Sienar Fleet Systems' latest later cannon prototype increases the firepower of most imperial TIEs - but many Moffs consider the weapon too expensive for widespread use.

property.name: FirstBox
property.value: STARSHIP WEAPON

property.name: GameText
property.value: Use 1 Force to deploy on any TIE. May target using 1 Force. Draw destiny. Capital starship hit if destiny-2 > armor. Starfighter hit if destiny > manuever.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: A panic move by Black 2 sent Vader spinning wildly from the Death Star trench - ironically sparing his life. His destiny would have been fulfilled another time.

property.name: FirstBox
property.value: USED OR LOST INTERRUPT

property.name: GameText
property.value: USED: Cancel all Revolutions in play (owner loses 1 Force for each). LOST: If Vader or Vader's Custom TIE was just lost, move that card to Used Pile instead. OR Save to your Used Pile one Imperial just lost from any Death Star location.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Dejarik hologram of creature from Clak'dor VII. Ghhhk rise with the dawn, screeching their mating calls across the jungle. Locals use their skin oils as a healing salve.

property.name: FirstBox
property.value: LOST INTERRUPT

property.name: GameText
property.value: If you just lost a battle and after having forfeited all cards from the battle location still have battle damage remaining, cancel all the remaining battle damage. (Immune to Sense.) OR Cancel Nightfall.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Male Rodian bounty hunter. Sent by Jabba to capture Han. Arrogant, overconfident and not too bright. Trained by bounty hunters Nataz and Goa, who betrayed him to Thuku.

property.name: GameText
property.value: During opponent's control phase, may 'threaten' one smuggler at same site. Opponent may use all Force Pile cards to cancel threat, allowing you to activate same amount. Otherwise, draw destiny. If destiny + Greedo's ability >6, smuggler lost.

property.name: Attrition
property.value: ½

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Male scout from Cona. As with many Arconas, Hem has succumbed to the power of salt, an addiction indicated by his gold eye color.

property.name: GameText
property.value: During your deploy phase, you may place, face down, one card from your hand or Force Pile under Hem, as 'salt consumption.' If Hem lost, cards underneath also lost. *Power=1 + number of cards underneath.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Full Imperial scans include full-spectrum transceivers, dedicated energy receptors, crystal gravfield traps, and hyperwave signal interceptors.

property.name: GameText
property.value: Deploy on your side of table. Scanning Crew is now immune to Sense. If Scanning Crew is played against an opponent who has 13 or more cards in hand, opponent also loses all cards with 'Rebel' in card name found there.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Truth drugs like Bavo Six decrease resistance to interrogation. The enormous needle adds psychological pressure, facilitating the interrogation process.

property.name: GameText
property.value: Deploy on IT-O. If present with a captive during your control phase: You may ask one yes-or-no question about the cards in opponent's hand. Opponent must tell the truth or refuse to answer by losing 1 Force. OR Increase Force drain by 1.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: In the defense of the Death Star at the Battle of Yavin, Darth Vader took the lead attacker, supported by his wingmen Black 2 and Black 3.

property.name: FirstBox
property.value: LOST INTERRUPT

property.name: GameText
property.value: Target any starfighter making an Attack Run. Draw destiny and add 1 for each TIE you have in the Death Star: Trench. If total > maneuver, starfighter is lost. OR Add 1 to weapon destiny draws of any starfighter for remainder of this turn.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Typical Imperial leader. Uses constant training and crisis simulations to help maintain high performance levels. Commander Daine Jir is known to be bold and outspoken.

property.name: GameText
property.value: Other Imperials (except leaders) at same site are forfeit +1.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: DarkLocationText
property.value: 'Dejarik Rules' in effect here.

property.name: LightLocationText
property.value: 'Dejarik Rules' in effect here. Site converted by Dejarik Hologameboard.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: 'There's nothing you could have done Luke, had you been there. You'd have been killed too.'

property.name: GameText
property.value: If opponent is generating at least 4 more Force than you, deploy on a location to cancel all Force generation at that location. OR Deploy on a location. It is now immune to Revolution.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Captain Mod Terrik, a typical office of the Desert Sands sandtrooper unit. Fearless and highly motivated. Willing to sacrifice as many troops as necessary.

property.name: GameText
property.value: When moving with a 'squad' of exactly three troopers, all four move for 1 Force. Your troopers at same site are forfeit +1. Imperial Trooper Guards may move with Imperial Squad Leader (at normal use of the Force).

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: The Empire's network of spies and petty informants allows Imperial operatives to discover and react to Rebel assaults before they occur.

property.name: FirstBox
property.value: USED INTERRUPT

property.name: GameText
property.value: Any of your characters at sites adjacent to one of your Undercover spies may move as a 'react' to that spy's site for free. OR Cancel Sabotage.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Floating prisoner interrogation droid. Uses probes and needles to dispense truth drugs and perform 'surgery.' Sensors determine subjects pain threshold and truthfulness.

property.name: FirstBox
property.value: INTERROGATOR DROID

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Built from scavenged parts. Jawa blasters are not required to adhere to any design standards. An etching on the stock warns 'datanni greb zroom.'

property.name: FirstBox
property.value: CHARACTER WEAPON

property.name: GameText
property.value: Deploy for free on any Jawa. May target for free. Draw destiny. Character hit if destiny -1 > ability. Jawa Blaster explodes, causing it and character firing it to be lost, if destiny =0.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: DarkLocationText
property.value: If you control, Force drain +1 here and all Wookiees on table are forfeit -3.

property.name: LightLocationText
property.value: Your starships with any Wookiee aboard are power and forfeit +2 here.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: DarkLocationText
property.value: If you occupy with exactly 2 starships, your total power here is +2 and Tonnika Sisters anywhere are doubled.

property.name: LightLocationText
property.value: If you occupy with exactly 2 starships, your total power here is +2.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Tusken Raiders,Jawas and other desert dwellers believe that krayt dragon bones possess mystical power that can bring good or bad luck.

property.name: GameText
property.value: Use 1 Force to deploy on table. Each opponent's destiny draw, you do the following: (0) Put top used card in hand; (1) lose 1 Force; (2) activate 1 Force; (3) lose this Effect; (4) retrieve top lost card; (5) deploy a character for free; (6+) nothing.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Security corridors are guarded by a grid of laser emplacements which can be activated upon demand to seal off sensitive areas from intrusion.

property.name: GameText
property.value: Deploy between any two interior mobile sites. To pass, a character must have (power+ability) >4 or use a Life Tube (all other vehicles are blocked). Laser Gate armor =3; may be targeted by a character weapon from either site.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: FirstBox
property.value: AUTOMATED WEAPON

property.name: GameText
property.value: Use 1 Force to deploy on opponent's side at any unoccupied site. Moves during your control phase, like a character, at nromal use of the Force. When present with Leia or a warrior of ability <3, choose one to be lost. Seeker also lost.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Bith mercenary. Male back-up Kloo Horn player in Figrin D'an's band. Only musician, besides Doikk, who has not lost ownership of his instruments to Figrin.

property.name: GameText
property.value: When at same site as other musicians, Lirin collects a 'cover charge.' For each other musician present, add 1 to the 'cost' for any character to move or deploy to same site.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Gantry officer charged with maintaining magnetic field, atmosphere and security in Death Star docking bay. After mission on Raltiir, paranoid about infiltration by Rebel spies.

property.name: GameText
property.value: While at Docking Control Room 327, adds 2 to your total power at Docking Bay 327. Once per turn during your control phase, if at same site as an Undercover spy, may draw destiny. Spy's 'cover is broken' if destiny = spy's ability.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Demoted after a superior blamed him for a clerical error. Considered a bully by fellow officers. Fanatically supports the New Order doctrine of alien subjugation.

property.name: GameText
property.value: Power +2 when at Detention Block Corridor or Detention Block Control Room. Also, power +2 when an opponent's alien is present (+3 if alien is a Wookiee, Talz or Ewok).

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: GameText
property.value: Deploy on your Sandcrawler. During your control phase, may target one character present. Draw destiny. If destiny > character's ability, 'suck up' character (relocate to related interior Sandcrawler site or owner's Used Pile).

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: 'Luke, at that speed will you be able to pull out in time?'

property.name: GameText
property.value: Deploy on Death Star: Trench. Opponent must make maneuver checks for starfighters leaving the trench. For each starfighter, owner draws destiny. If destiny + maneuver <5, starfighter is lost.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Enclosed landspeeder often used by nefarious characters due to its luxury and evasive capabilities. Features include automated steering and fine Corellian leather.

property.name: FirstBox
property.value: TRANSPORT VEHICLE

property.name: GameText
property.value: May carry 2 passengers. Moves free if Jabba or any bounty hunter aboard. Also, may move for free as a 'react' only to a battle where you have a theif, smuggler or bounty hunter.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Dejarik creature. Savage predator from remote deserts of Soccorro. Respected and honored by Soccorran hunters, considered 'good luck' by superstitious smugglers.

property.name: FirstBox
property.value: USED OR LOST INTERRUPT

property.name: GameText
property.value: USED: If opponent has 13 or more cards in hand, place all but 8 (random selection) in Used Pile. LOST: Use 4 Force to cause opponent to reveal hand. All cards opponent has two or more of are lost.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Jabba's Nimbanel accountant. Inside contacts allow him to disrupt the cash flow of the Hutt's enemies. He knows a mistake could make him the next write-off.

property.name: GameText
property.value: When opponent is losing Force from Force drains at the same or an adjacent site, lost Force must come from Reserve Deck if possible.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Dejarik hologram of a Ng'ok war beast. Foul temper gives rise to bad feelings. Has razor-sharp retractable claws. Used in many systems to frighten off potential attackers.

property.name: FirstBox
property.value: USED INTERRUPT

property.name: GameText
property.value: If opponent just deployed four or more characters at same location this turn, prevent all of those characters from battling this turn. OR If opponent just 'reacted' to a battle, cancel the battle.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: This Imperial Intelligence leader has a proven track record for predicting Rebel fleet movements. His coordination of starship maneuvers has saved many vulnerable bases.

property.name: GameText
property.value: Add 2 to power of any starship he pilots. When at a Death Star site, Imperial starships may move to the Death Star system as a 'react'.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Greedo cheskopokuta klees ruya Solo. Hoko yanee boopa gush Cantina. Cheeco wa Solo's anye nyuma Greedo vakee. Jabba kul steeka et en anpaw.

property.name: FirstBox
property.value: USED INTERRUPT

property.name: GameText
property.value: If Nabrun Leids just completed a transport, use 2 Force. Nabrun is lost and all Rebels transported are captured. (Immune to Sense.) OR Prevent a just-deployed smuggler from moving this turn. OR Cancel a Kessel Run.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Imperial slicers imbed a secret command in a droid's primary performance banks. A predetermined trigger causes a power overload, destroying the droid and anything nearby.

property.name: GameText
property.value: Use 2 Force to deploy on an opponent's droid (except R2-D2 and C-3PO), 1 on your droid. The next time either player draws a destiny matching the number of characters at same site, droid explodes, causing all characters present to be lost.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: R2 units are known for expertise in computer uplinking. R2-Q2 spent several decades serving with an Imperial reconnaissance fleet in the Expansion Region.

property.name: FirstBox
property.value: ASTROMECH DROID

property.name: GameText
property.value: While aboard any starfighter, adds 1 to power, maneuver and hyperspeed. When at a Scomp link during your draw phase, may use 1 Force to look at top three cards of your Reserve Pile.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: R3 units have larger memory and more advanced circuitry than their R1 predecessors, allowing for more efficient astrogation plots. R3-T6 served on the Death Star.

property.name: FirstBox
property.value: ASTROMECH DROID

property.name: GameText
property.value: When aboard a capital starship, adds 1 to power and 2 to hyperspeed, and that starship is immune to attrition <4. When at Death Star: Central Core, adds 1 to hyperspeed of Death Star system.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Seldom used for navigation purposes, R5 units are known for their ability to perform hull maintenance and repair damage caused by ionization.

property.name: FirstBox
property.value: ASTROMECH DROID

property.name: GameText
property.value: While aboard any starship, adds 1 to power and maneuver. If on a starship hit by an Ion Cannon, restores armor/maneuver and hyperspeed during your next control phase.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: DarkLocationText
property.value: Devastator is power +1 here and may move to or from here for free.

property.name: LightLocationText
property.value: Tantive IV is power +1 here.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Ranat thief and scavenger from Aralia. Regularly trades with Jawas. Adept at pilfering items without alerting the owner. Willing to steal anything, even trash.

property.name: GameText
property.value: Once during each of your control phases, may lose 1 Force to take one vehicle, droid, weapon or device from opponent's Lost Pile or Crash Site Memorial into hand to use as your own.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Injuries kept Lord Vader's best TIE wingman out of the primary wave of starfighters. He remains on reserve duty, ready to replace lost pilots.

property.name: GameText
property.value: Adds 1 to power of anything he pilots. When piloting Black 2, Black 3 or Black 4, also adds 1 to maneuver and draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Strategically retracted bridges can frustrate enemy movement, forcing routing plans to be rearranged.

property.name: FirstBox
property.value: LOST INTERRUPT

property.name: GameText
property.value: During your deploy phase, use X Force to rearrange all interior Death Star sites, where X = total number of those sites. All cards at a given site move along with that site. OR Cancel On The Edge.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Thuku is a typical male Rodian. Sent to hunt down Greedo by Navik the Red, head of the Chattza tribe. Rodians enjoy 'the hunt,' so many are employed as assassins.

property.name: GameText
property.value: Adds 1 to power of each of your bounty hunters and smugglers (but subtracts 1 from Greedo's power) at same site. Adds 1 to power of anything he pilots.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: DarkLocationText
property.value: Deploy on your Sandcrawler. Jawas forfeit +2 here. 'Nighttime conditions' here.

property.name: LightLocationText
property.value: Your characters may enter/exit here for 1 Force each. 'Nighttime conditions' here.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Tusken Raiders often attack lone desert travelers at long range. Their cowardly nature leads them to rely on surprise attacks rather than direct engagement.

property.name: FirstBox
property.value: LOST INTERRUPT

property.name: GameText
property.value: During your control phase, fire one of your weapons. If URoRRuR'R'R firing, may add 2 to each weapon destiny draw. (A seeker may be targeted by a character weapon using defense value of 4.) Any 'hit' targets are immediately lost.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Captives sent to the Kessel spice mines spend the rest of their lives digging for glitterstim, a spice sold throughout the galaxy by smugglers and crime lords.

property.name: FirstBox
property.value: UTINNI EFFECT

property.name: GameText
property.value: Deploy on Kessel (may not be moved). Target one captive and one trooper to escort captive. When targets reach Utinni Effect, retrieve lost Force equal to captive's forfeit (captive and Utinni Effect lost). If trooper lost en route, captive released.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Stormtroopers are trained to stun, not kill, priority targets in order to split enemy forces and hold the leaders for interrogation. Stun effects wear off, requiring efficient action.

property.name: FirstBox
property.value: LOST INTERRUPT

property.name: GameText
property.value: After a battle at an interior site is initiated, use 1 Force to cause all leaders and all characters with ability >2 (on both sides) to be completely excluded from that battle.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: The Death Star has more firepower than the combined might of the entire Imperial fleet. Enormous generators power the devastating planet-destroying weapon.

property.name: FirstBox
property.value: DEATH STAR WEAPON

property.name: GameText
property.value: Deploy on Death Star system at parsec 0. May target a capital starship at Death Star system, or at a system it orbits, using 4 Force. Draw two destiny. Capital starship hit if total destiny > armor.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Petty criminals throughout the galaxy often earn extra money by teaching their trade to initiates. Thievery has become more popular as the Empire tightens its grip.

property.name: GameText
property.value: Deploy on any non-thief to give that character thief skill. During your control phase, may target one device at same site. Draw destiny. If destiny < target's destiny number, it is 'stolen'. OR Deploy on a weapon to prevent theft. (Immune to Alter.)

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: DarkLocationText
property.value: 'Bluff Rules' in effect here.

property.name: LightLocationText
property.value: 'Bluff Rules' in effect here.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Male Bith musician. Plays Ommni Box in Figrin D'an's band. Lost ownership of instrument to Figrin while gambling.

property.name: GameText
property.value: After using Ommni Box, peek at top X cards of pile or deck just shuffled, where X = number of other musicians at same site. May re-shuffle without peeking.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Dianogas use their seven tentacles for both locomotion and catching food. The few survivors of such attacks claim that a dianoga tentacle has the strength of a hydro-clamp.

property.name: FirstBox
property.value: IMMEDIATE EFFECT

property.name: GameText
property.value: Use 1 Force to deploy on table just after opponent has played any Interrupt. That Interrupt is still played out but is then 'grabbed' (placed here but is out of play). Any new Interrupts of the same name are now unique (*). (Immune to Control.)

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Luke's dream of joining the academy often distracted him from his chores, sometimes resulting in his having to pay the price for his impatience.

property.name: FirstBox
property.value: IMMEDIATE EFFECT

property.name: GameText
property.value: Use 3 Force to deploy on table and stack one just-played Interrupt here. To play any new Interrupt of the same name, player must first stack it here and use +1 Force for each Interrupt in stack, even if Interrupt is normally free. (Immune to Control.)

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: 'When you came in here, didn't you have a plan for getting out?'

property.name: FirstBox
property.value: USED INTERRUPT

property.name: GameText
property.value: Cancel I'm Here To Rescue You, Plastoid Armor, Out Of Commission, Alternatives To Fighting, Cell 2187 or Ewok Rescue.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Imperial strategy relies on quantity over quality. Although many of their pilots have low motivation, this is compensated for by 'wolfpack' group tactics.

property.name: FirstBox
property.value: SQUADRON: TIE/LN

property.name: SecondBox
property.value: NO HYPERDRIVE

property.name: GameText
property.value: *Replaces 3 TIE/LNs at one location (TIE/LNs go to Used Pile). Permanent pilots aboard provide total ability of 3.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Reconnaissance starfighter. Often deployed first to gather detailed information on enemy starship movement before full fleet engagement.

property.name: FirstBox
property.value: STARFIGHTER: TIE/RC

property.name: SecondBox
property.value: NO HYPERDRIVE

property.name: GameText
property.value: Permanent pilot aboard provides ability of 1. If opponent just initiated a battle at same system, you may 'react' by deploying cards (at normal use of the Force) to that system.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Captures enemy vessels for boarding. When used in conjunction with an ion cannon, tractor beams can ensnare even the most maneuverable starships.

property.name: GameText
property.value: Use 2 Force to deploy on a Star Destroyer. At the end of a battle, may target a starship present (except Mon Calamari Star Cruiser) using 2 Force. Draw destiny. Starship captured if destiny > armor or maneuver.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Dispatched to Tatooine to apprehend renegade droids fleeing the Tantive IV. Suspected to have misgivings about Imperial methods. Allegedly shot his commander in the back.

property.name: GameText
property.value: While on Tatooine, causes Local Trouble and Look Sir, Droids to become Used Interrupts. Opponent may select target when using Friendly Fire at same site as Felth.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: This protocol droid served in the House of Alderaan's Diplomatic Corps. Imperials altered its programming for espionage, making the droid an unwitting spy for the Empire.

property.name: FirstBox
property.value: PROTOCOL DROID

property.name: GameText
property.value: Deploy on opponent's side as an Undercover spy (except that if present during a battle at a site, adds its power to Light Side). If spy's 'cover is broken,' the above 'game text' is cancelled and Light Side may use as if 'stolen'.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: The Empire maintains a network of spies attempting to infiltrate the Rebel Alliance or disinform their operatives.

property.name: GameText
property.value: Deploy on your spy at a site and cross spy to opponent's side. Spy is now Undercover. If at a site during your deploy phase, may voluntarily 'break cover' (lose Effect).

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Leader of a Tusken Raider tribe. Unafraid of machines. Skilled hunter and marksman. Raids moisture farms for water. Roams the Jundland Wastes in search of unwary travelers.

property.name: GameText
property.value: Deploy only on Tatooine, but may move elsewhere. When at same site as another Tusken Raider, may draw one battle destiny if not able to otherwise.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Owning a hunting rifle is an important status symbol is Tusken culture. URoRRuR'R'R scavenged this weapon from a starship wreck near Anchorhead.

property.name: FirstBox
property.value: CHARACTER WEAPON

property.name: GameText
property.value: Use 1 Force to deploy on URoRRuR'R'R or Chief Bast, 3 on any non-droid character (even if not a warrior). may target using 1 Force. Draw destiny. Character hit if destiny -1 > ability. Creature immediately lost if destiny+2 > defense value.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Commissioned by the Old Republic at end of the Clone Wars, Rendili StarDrive's Victory-class starship is atmosphere-capable but has a low sublight speed.

property.name: FirstBox
property.value: CAPITAL: VICTORY-CLASS STAR DESTROYER

property.name: GameText
property.value: May add 4 pilots, 6 passengers, 1 vehicle and 3 TIEs. Has ship-docking capability. Permanent pilot aboard provides ability of 1. Adds 1 to your total power in battles at related planet sites.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: 'You are part of the Rebel Alliance, and a traitor. Take her away!'

property.name: FirstBox
property.value: LOST INTERRUPT

property.name: GameText
property.value: Use 1 Force if opponent just lost or forfeited a character from battle. It is captured instead. OR Use X Force to capture all characters on board a captured starship, where X = twice the number of characters.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Multi-armed maintenance droid fiercely loyal to the Empire. Specializes in extending effective operational life of Imperial resources. Nicknamed for an insect from Eriadu.

property.name: FirstBox
property.value: MAINTENANCE DROID

property.name: GameText
property.value: *Forfeit value begins at 7. When 'forfeited,' droid remains in play, but forfeit value is reduced by the amount of attrition or battle damage absorbed. Droid lost when forfeit value reaches zero.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Early warning and careful planning allow the Rebels to achieve maximum readiness while still maintaining optimal flexibility.

property.name: FirstBox
property.value: USED OR LOST INTERRUPT

property.name: GameText
property.value: USED: Place out of play any one of the following from your hand: Attack Run, You're All Clear Kid, Death Star: Trench or Rebel Tech. Retrieve 1 Force.\n\nLOST: Use 3 Force to retrieve Attack Run.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: The Rebellion's limited resources force it to consider the wisdom of any military encounter. In many cases, retreat or deception is a preferable recourse.

property.name: FirstBox
property.value: LOST INTERRUPT

property.name: GameText
property.value: Use 3 Force to cancel a battle just initiated at a system or sector. OR Cancel Besieged. OR Release (move for free) all your characters from a captured starship to your side of any docking bay site.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Unut Poll is a typical male Arcona. Unlike many other Arconas, he has avoided salt. Scout known to cooperate with Alliance operatives.

property.name: GameText
property.value: Power +1 under 'nighttime conditions.' May move away from a battle at same site as a 'react'.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: GameText
property.value:
Deploy on Death Star: Trench.
During your move phase, you may make an Attack Run as follows:
Enter Trench: Move up to 3 of your starfighters into trench (for free). Dark Side may immediately follow with up to 3 TIEs (for free).
Provide Cover: Identify your lead starfighter (Proton Torpedoes* required) and wingmen (if any). Turbolaser Batteries and TIEs with weapons may now target your starfighters (wingmen first, then lead if no wingmen remaining). Hit starfighters are immediately lost.
It's Away!: Draw two destiny.
Pull Up!: All starfighters now move to Death Star system (for free). If (total destiny + X + Y - Z) > 15, Death Star is 'blown away.'
X = ability of lead pilot or 3 if Targeting Computer is present.
Y = total sites at largest Rebel Base (Yavin 4 or Hoth).
Z = highest ability of TIE pilots in trench.
*Your Proton Torpedoes are immune to Overload.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: When Vader turned his attention to the escaping Rebels, Han immediately offered Luke some sage advice.

property.name: FirstBox
property.value: LOST INTERRUPT

property.name: GameText
property.value: If a battle was just initiated at an interior site, use 1 Force to exclude from that battle all characters of ability > 2 and all leaders (on both sides).

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Nutrient-rich beverage common in moisture farm communities. Rumored to have medicinal qualities. Popular in cantinas among those who can't hold their juri juice.

property.name: FirstBox
property.value: USED OR LOST INTERRUPT

property.name: GameText
property.value: USED: Select a player to activate 1 Force.\n\nLOST: Cancel Juri Juice or Hypo.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Hand-crafted weapon of choice among Wookiees. Fires explosive 'quarrels' (which look like blaster bolts). Requires great strength to use. Extra ammo carried on bandoleers.

property.name: FirstBox
property.value: CHARACTER WEAPON

property.name: GameText
property.value: Use X Force to deploy on your warrior, where X = (7 - warrior's power). X cannot fall below 1. May target a character or creature using X Force. Draw destiny. Add 1 if targeting a character, 2 if targeting a creature. Target hit if total destiny > defense value.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: BoShek nicknamed this male Siniteen 'Brainiac' due to his ability to calculate hyperspace coordinates in his head. 'He's the brains, sweetheart!'

property.name: GameText
property.value: * Power = sqrt(3(X-Y)+2(A-B)+ p) (minimum power =1). X = Dark Side hand cards; Y = Light Side hand cards; A = total number of Dark icons in play; B = total number of Light icons in play; pi= 3.141592653589793238462643383...

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: 'Aren't you a little short for a stormtrooper?'

property.name: FirstBox
property.value: UTINNI EFFECT

property.name: GameText
property.value: Deploy on any Death Star site except Docking Bay 327. Target your spy or leader not on Death Star. When target reaches Utinni Effect, draw destiny. Release that many captives from the Detention Block Corridor. Lose Utinni Effect.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Wookiee smuggler from Kashyyyk. Over 200 years old. Top-notch mechanic and pilot. Jabba has large bounty on this 'walking carpet.' Friends call him Chewie...or Fuzzball.

property.name: GameText
property.value: Power +1 at same location as Han. Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. When piloting Falcon, also adds 1 to maneuver. Your vehicles, starships and droids at same site go to Used Pile (rather than Lost Pile) when they are 'hit.'

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: DarkLocationText
property.value: If you control, all Bith characters are destiny -1 and Ghhhk is power +2 in dejarik battles.

property.name: LightLocationText
property.value: If you occupy, all Bith characters are destiny +2

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Popular leader whose expertise in space defense and orbital battle stations enabled the Alliance to uncover a fatal flaw in the Death Star's design.

property.name: GameText
property.value: When at a Yavin 4, Hoth or Endor site, Rebel starships may move to the related system as a 'react'.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Leader of Rebel forces on Yavin 4. Formerly Suolriep sector HQ commander. As a Rebel spy, aided Princess Leia and Bail Organa in the years prior to the Senate's dissolution.

property.name: GameText
property.value: When at a war room you control, adds 1 to power of each Rebel starship at the related system. May use 1 Force to cancel Astromech Shortage.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: The huge strain on the little-tested power generator matrix of the superlaser's fusion reactor can require full recharging before the system can be used again.

property.name: GameText
property.value: Deploy on a superlaser. May not fire at a planet until 'recharged.' Opponent may use Force (stacking it here); accumulating 8 Force recharges superlaser. When fired at a planet, Effect is canceled. If Effect canceled, accumulated Force is placed in Used Pile.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: DarkLocationText
property.value: Your starships are hyperspeed +1 when moving from here.

property.name: LightLocationText
property.value: Your Corellian Corvettes and Milennium Falcon may deploy here as a 'react'.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Brindy Truchong is a typical female Corellian smuggler. Her goal in Mos Eisley is to find a quick means of providing supplies to the Rebellion.

property.name: GameText
property.value: Once per turn, one weapon or device is deploy -1 onto a Rebel at same site.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: First perfected by Corellian starship battle tacticians, this dangerous counter-maneuver has saved numerous hot-shot pilots in life-or-death situations.

property.name: FirstBox
property.value: USED INTERRUPT

property.name: GameText
property.value: If opponent just initiated a Tallon Roll, add your maneuver + ability of one pilot on you targeted starfighter to your total. OR Decrease the maneuver of an opponent's starfighter by 1 for remainder of this turn.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: DarkLocationText
property.value: 'Trench rules' in effect, your weapons fire free and Turbolaser Battery may deploy here.

property.name: LightLocationText
property.value: 'Trench rules' in effect and your starfighters are maneuver -2 here.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: DarkLocationText
property.value: 'Dejarik Rules' in effect here. Site converted by Imperial Holotable.

property.name: LightLocationText
property.value: 'Dejarik Rules' in effect here.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Male Bith musician. Plays Fizz (Dorenian Beshniquel) in Figrin D'an's band. Frustrated by sentients, especially humans, he prefers to work with droids.

property.name: GameText
property.value: For each other musician at same site, the ability required to draw battle destiny here increases by 1 for both players.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Typical of impersonators, Shada double-crossed everyone. Her true affiliations still remain a mystery.

property.name: FirstBox
property.value: LOST INTERRUPT

property.name: GameText
property.value: If both players have a spy at same site, draw destiny. Add 2 if opponent's spy is Undercover. Opponent's spy is lost if destiny > 2. OR Opponent's Tonnika Sisters present at a site cross to your side.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: The Guiderhouser ejection seat has saved many pilots from their exploding starships. However, system malfunctions have sometimes caused spontaneous ejection.

property.name: GameText
property.value: Use 1 Force to target a starfighter having one or more permanent pilots. Draw destiny. If destiny > 2, deploy on starfighter to remove all permanent pilots (otherwise, Effect is lost). May add 1 pilot for each permanent pilot removed. (Immune to Alter.)

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Among the various special devices on droids like R2 units are gasbased fire extinguishers. Effective against electrical fires and can cause confusion during battle.

property.name: GameText
property.value: Deploy on your astromech droid. Cancels an 'exploding' Program Trap here. Any starship it is aboard is immune to Lateral Damage and ion cannons. If deployed on R2-D2, may lose Fire Extinguisher to cancel a battle just initiated where present at a site.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Free-trader who imports ice chunks from rings of Ohann and Adriana, outer planets in Tatoo system. Sales remain cold...due to steep Imperial taxes and bribes.

property.name: GameText
property.value: Adds 1 to power of anything he pilots. Adds 1 to forfeit of each of your characters at same Tatooine site. Subtracts 1 from forfeit of each of opponent's characters at same Hoth site. Game text suspended if at same site as a tax collector.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Tiree's Y-wing during the Battle of Yavin. Custom high-power lateral thrusters provide enhanced maneuverability, allowing Gold 2 to better draw and evade enemy fire.

property.name: FirstBox
property.value: STARFIGHTER: Y-WING

property.name: GameText
property.value: May add 2 pilots or passengers. May forfeit in place of your other starfighter hit in Death Star: Trench, restoring that starfighter to normal.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Stormtrooper utility belts contain basic tools such as a grappling hook to grab onto protrusions. The hook can also be used to ensnare escaping targets.

property.name: FirstBox
property.value: IMMEDIATE EFFECT

property.name: GameText
property.value: If opponent just played an Interrupt, use 1 Force to deploy on table. That Interrupt is played out but is then 'grappled' (placed here but is out of play). Any new Interrupts of the same name are now unique (•). (Immune to Control.)

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Dejarik representation of mythical Molator guardian. The spirit of Grimtaash is said to protect Alderaanian royalty from corruption and betrayal.

property.name: FirstBox
property.value: USED OR LOST INTERRUPT

property.name: GameText
property.value: USED: If opponent has 13 or more cards in hand, place all but 8 (random selection) in Used Pile.\n\nLOST: Cancel Molator (even at a holosite). OR Use 4 Force to reveal opponent's hand. All cards opponent has two or more of in hand are lost.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Jawa scout. Wants to avenge deaths of relatives killed in stormtrooper assault on sandcrawler. Reegesk pilfered the powerpack from his blaster at a critical moment.

property.name: GameText
property.value: * Deploys only on Tatooine for 2 Force from each player's Force Pile. Het is power +1 for each Stormtrooper at same site, unless Reegesk is present.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Dejarik creature. These ferocious-looking beasts are gentle, loyal, and often domesticated as guard animals or pets on Kinyen, the Gran homeworld. Incendiary.

property.name: FirstBox
property.value: LOST INTERRUPT

property.name: GameText
property.value: During the damage segment of a battle you lost, if you have no cards left that can be forfeited, cancel all remaining battle damage. (Immune to Sense.) OR Cancel Sunsdown.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: What hump?

property.name: Ability
property.value: 1½

property.name: GameText
property.value: On a hunch, if opponent just initiated a Force drain at an adjacent site, you may use 1 Force to search opponent's Force Pile and place out of play one card there that has 'back' in the title; reshuffle.

card.name: I Have A Very Bad Feeling About This

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: 'Look at him, he's heading for that small moon.' Luke became apprehensive when Obi-Wan informed him, 'That's no moon. It's a space station.'

property.name: FirstBox
property.value: USED INTERRUPT

property.name: GameText
property.value: If opponent just deployed four or more characters to same location this turn, prevent all of those characters from battling this turn. OR If opponent just 'reacted' to a battle, cancel the battle.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: FirstBox
property.value: USED INTERRUPT

property.name: GameText
property.value: If you have a spy present at the Detention Block Corridor, target a captive there. Draw destiny. If destiny + ability of spy > ability of captive, target is released. Otherwise, spy is captured. OR Cancel Spice Mines Of Kessel (releasing targeted captive).

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Male Bith musician. His favorite cantina song is 'Tears of Aquanna' (mainly because it features him on Fanfar).

property.name: GameText
property.value: Opponent must use X Force when Force draining at any adjacent site, where X = the number of other musicians present with Ickabel.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Enclosed vehicle used for shuttling and hot-rodding. E-16/x ion engine pushes T-16 up to 1200 kph.

property.name: FirstBox
property.value: SHUTTLE VEHICLE

property.name: GameText
property.value: May add 1 passenger. Permanent pilot provides ability of 1. May move as a 'react.' * Landspeed = 4. OR 1 character may shuttle to or from same site for free.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Cobbled-together weapon built from salvaged power cells, droid restraining bolts and an ion accelerator. Fires a stream of ion energy that stuns droids and irritates others.

property.name: FirstBox
property.value: CHARACTER WEAPON

property.name: GameText
property.value: Use 1 Force to deploy on your Jawa, 3 on your warrior. May target a character using 1 Force. Draw destiny. Targeted droid stolen if destiny +1 > forfeit. Targeted non-droid character excluded from battle if destiny = defense value.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: DarkLocationText
property.value: Total ability of 6 or more required for you to draw battle destiny here.

property.name: LightLocationText
property.value: Your Wookiees and smugglers deploy -2 here.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: 'It's not wise to upset a Wookiee.' 'But sir, nobody worries about upsetting a droid.' 'That's cause a droid don't pull people's arms out of their sockets when they lose.'

property.name: FirstBox
property.value: LOST INTERRUPT

property.name: GameText
property.value: During a battle at a holosite, add one battle destiny. OR Target an opponent's character of ability <5 present with your Wookiee that just participated in a battle you lost; character is Disarmed (power -1 and may no longer carry weapons). Stack on that character.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: The Empire's tremendous military machine requires extensive coordination at every level. Slight errors in any step can quickly escalate supply delays.

property.name: GameText
property.value: Use 3 Force to deploy on opponent's side of table. All opponent's TIEs are deploy +1.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: A symbol of the adventurous pilot and the awakening of his destiny. 'You've taken your first step into a larger world.'

property.name: GameText
property.value: Use 2 Force to deploy on a Rebel or alien. If Luke's Cape is not at a Tatooine location, your total Force generation is +1. That character is immune to attrition <3.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Czerka 6-2Aug2. Extended barrel provides long-range targeting without expensive laser sight. Sturdy construction, but no match for a Tusken Raider's gaderffi stick.

property.name: FirstBox
property.value: CHARACTER WEAPON

property.name: GameText
property.value: Use 1 Force to deploy on Luke or Owen Lars, 3 on your non-droid character. May target a character or creature using 1 Force. Draw destiny. Subtract 1 if targeting a character. Add 2 if targeting a creature. Target hit if total destiny > defense value.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Pretentious hydroponics droid. Specializes in working with binary load lifters and vaporators. Proficient in a number of languages but prefers to converse only in binary.

property.name: FirstBox
property.value: BINARY HYDROPONICS DROID

property.name: GameText
property.value: Adds 2 to forfeit of each non-droid character at same and adjacent sites. At any time, any player may use 1 Force to turn M-HYD off (face down) or on again (face up).

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Retractable tube originally designed to collect mined materials for transport to refining facilities. Jawas now use it to suck up droids (and anything else that's not nailed down).

property.name: GameText
property.value: Deploy on your sandcrawler. Once during each of your control phases, may target one character present. Draw destiny. If destiny > character's ability, 'suck up' character (relocate to related interior Sandcrawler site or owner's Used Pile).

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: A crafty purloiner from Tirac Munda with a heart of gold. Often hired to advise the wealthy on how to protect their own property. Well traveled and skilled in many languages.

property.name: GameText
property.value: Deploy on your non-thief to give that character thief skill. Once during each of your control phases, may target one device at same site. Draw destiny. If destiny < target's destiny number, it is stolen. OR Deploy on a weapon to prevent theft. (Immune to Alter.)

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Military version of a 'remote.' Programmed to stalk specific targets or secondary targets. Heat and light sensors track with fatal accuracy. Can stow away on starships.

property.name: FirstBox
property.value: AUTOMATED WEAPON

property.name: GameText
property.value: Deploys for 1 Force to an unoccupied site. Deploys and moves like an undercover spy. When present with Motti (or pilot) of ability <3, choose one to be immediately lost (treat as an 'all cards' situation). Seeker also lost.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Male Bith musician. Though he enjoys playing his Bandfill in Figrin D'an's band, he misses the bubblink pink swamps of his homeworld, Clak'dor VII.

property.name: GameText
property.value: After using Bith Shuffle, peek at top X cards of pile or deck just shuffled, where X = number of other musicians at same site. May reshuffle without peeking.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: 'I hope that old man got the tractor beam out of commission or this is gonna be a real short trip.'

property.name: FirstBox
property.value: USED INTERRUPT

property.name: GameText
property.value: During your control phase, use 2 Force to release a starship held by any Tractor Beam. (Not effective on Death Star Tractor Beam if Central Core in play.) OR Randomly select one card from opponent's Lost Pile or Blaster Rack and place out of play.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Smugglers and other rogues frequent spaceports along trade routes. 'Your friend is quite a mercenary. I wonder if he really cares about anything, or anybody.'

property.name: FirstBox
property.value: USED INTERRUPT

property.name: GameText
property.value: If Elis Helrot just completed a transport, use 2 Force. Elis and all character transported are lost. (Immune to Sense.) OR Prevent a just deployed smuggler from moving this turn.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Fiesty. Loyal. Heroic. Insecure. Rebel spy. Excels at trouble. Incorrigible counterpart of a mindless philosopher. Has picked up a slight flutter. A bit eccentric.

property.name: FirstBox
property.value: ASTROMECH DROID

property.name: GameText
property.value: While aboard any starfighter, adds 2 to power, maneuver and hyperspeed (3 on Red 5). If at a Scomp link when opponent draws destiny of: 1-3, you may activate one Force; 4-6, you may draw top card from Reserve Deck.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Cheap astromech droid commonly referred to as 'Red.' Purposely blew his motivator to prevent splitting up R2-D2 and C-3PO on Tatooine. Poor navigator but skilled mechanic.

property.name: FirstBox
property.value: ASTROMECH DROID

property.name: GameText
property.value: While aboard any starship, adds 1 to power and maneuver. During your control phase, if aboard your starship damaged by an ion cannon, restores armor/maneuver and hyperspeed.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: While aboard any starship, adds 1 to power and maneuver. During your control phase, if aboard your starship damaged by an ion cannon, restores armor/maneuver and hyperspeed.

property.name: FirstBox
property.value: SERVANT DROID

property.name: GameText
property.value: May transfer character weapons (for free) to or from your other characters present. May carry up to four such weapons at one time.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: DarkLocationText
property.value: Your capital starships deploy -2 here.

property.name: LightLocationText
property.value: Your starships may move here as a 'react'.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Commander Bob Hudsol. Typical of hard-line Corellian officers known for caution in battle. Leader of resistance in Bothan space. Developed strong ties to Bothan spynet.

property.name: GameText
property.value: Adds 1 to forfeit of each of your other Rebels (except leaders) at same site. Bothan spies deploy free to same location.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Lt. Pello Scrambas is a typical veteran officer in the Rebel forces. Loyally served the Organa family for nearly two decades as a guard for the Royal House of Alderaan.

property.name: GameText
property.value: Adds 1 to forfeit of your other troopers and Rebel Guards at same site. When moving with a 'squad' of exactly three other troopers and/or Rebel Guards, all four move for 1 Force. Rebel Guards at same site may move.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Fabritech communications and sensor array. Features active/passive scanners, powerful jamming system, ship-to-ship transmitters and short-range target acquisition program.

property.name: GameText
property.value: Use 1 Force to deploy on your starship. You may deploy cards as a 'react' to a battle at same system or sector.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Wedge's X-wing at Battle of Yavin. Wedge had to nurse the fighter home after a hit in the Death Star trench destroyed its micro-maneuvering controls.

property.name: FirstBox
property.value: STARFIGHTER: X-WING

property.name: GameText
property.value: May add 1 pilot and 1 astromech. Immune to attrition <3 if Wedge piloting.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Luke's Incom T-65 X-wing at the Battle of Yavin. Instrumentation similarities between Red 5 and the T-16 skyhopper allowed Luke to play a pivotal role in the conflict.

property.name: FirstBox
property.value: STARFIGHTER: X-WING

property.name: GameText
property.value: May add 1 pilot and 1 astromech. Immune to attrition <4 if Luke piloting. When firing in an Attack Run, adds 1 to total.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Jek Porkins' X-wing at Battle of Yavin. Instrumental in success of strafing attacks against Death Star. Skipped last inspection of computer and flight control systems.

property.name: FirstBox
property.value: STARFIGHTER: X-WING

property.name: GameText
property.value: May add 1 pilot. Opponent may add 2 to destiny drawn for I've Got A Problem Here when targeting Red 6.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Tshhhh. Tshhhh. Zap! 'Look...good against remotes is one thing. Good against the living, that's something else.

property.name: GameText
property.value: Use 1 Force to deploy at any site. Moves like a character at normal use of the Force. Once during each of your control phases, may: Select one character present to be power or forfeit +1 for remainder of turn. OR Use 2 Force to cancel any seeker present.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Fled into the wilderness after mistreatment by a young Tusken Raider. Raised by moisture farmer. Friendly toward strangers, but attacks Tusken Raiders on sight.

property.name: FirstBox
property.value: CREATURE VEHICLE

property.name: GameText
property.value: May add 2 'riders' (passengers). Bantha ability = 1/2. May move as a 'react.' Whenever a battle was just initiated at same site, one Tusken Raider present (your choice) is 'trampled' (immediately lost).

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Poorly equipped Rebels must rely on clandestine strikes against the massive Imperial military. Computer 'slicing' and system tampering have proven most effective.

property.name: FirstBox
property.value: USED INTERRUPT

property.name: GameText
property.value: During your control phase, target one weapon, device or vehicle at same site as your Undercover spy. Draw destiny. If destiny > target's deploy cost, target is lost (may be stolen instead if spy also a thief). OR Cancel Informant.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: DarkLocationText
property.value: Your characters may enter/exit here for 1 Force each. 'Nighttime conditions' here.

property.name: LightLocationText
property.value: Deploy on your Sandcrawler. Jawas forfeit +2 here. 'Nighttime conditions' here.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Hrchek Kal Fas, a male Saurin from Durkteel, is a typical droid trader. Scours the 'invisible market' for the best droid prices. Guarded by his cousin Sai'torr.

property.name: GameText
property.value: At any time, may use 1 Force to remove (lose) a Restraining Bolt at same site. Receives an extra power +1 when 'protected' by Sai'torr Kal Fas.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Specialized scanner technicians examine scanner output to identify the presence of life forms. Experienced operators can even identify species and gender.

property.name: GameText
property.value: Deploy on your side of table. Radar Scanner is immune to Sense. If Radar Scanner is played against an opponent who has more than 13 cards in hand, opponent loses all Jawas, Tusken Raiders and stormtroopers found there.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Monitors all nearby traffic in exterior locations. Takes advantage of multiple backup systems to minimize breakdowns under harsh conditions.

property.name: GameText
property.value: Use 1 Force to deploy on your non-creature vehicle. Adds 1 to power and landspeed. Once per turn, when you play Radar Scanner, you may use 1 Force to move one additional Effect or Interrupt card found in opponent's hand to Used Pile.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Veteran officer of the Old Republic who retired from active duty after the Clone Wars. Makes a living in the Outer Rim Territories passing on his scouting expertise.

property.name: GameText
property.value: Deploy on your warrior to give that warrior scout skill. That warrior may move as a 'react.' OR Deploy on your scout. When that scout 'reacts,' it is power +2 for remainder of turn. (Immune to Alter.)

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: 'I've been looking forward to this for a long time.' 'Yes, I'll bet you have.' Han abruptly ended his conversation with Greedo and flipped Wuher a credit to pay for the cleanup.

property.name: FirstBox
property.value: LOST INTERRUPT

property.name: GameText
property.value: During your control phase, fire one of your weapons. If Han firing, may add 1 to each weapon destiny draw. (A seeker may be targeted by a character weapon using defense value of 4.) Any 'hit' targets are immediately lost.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: ArMek SW-4 turret-mounted ion cannon. Bursts of ionized energy fuse and overload target's mechanical and computer systems. Allows ships to be captured and boarded.

property.name: FirstBox
property.value: STARSHIP WEAPON

property.name: GameText
property.value: Use 1 Force to deploy on your Y-wing or B-wing. May target a starship using 1 Force. Draw destiny. If destiny > target's defense value, all starship weapons deployed on target are lost, armor or maneuver = 0 and hyperspeed = 0.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Royal House of Alderaan consular ship. Used by Princess Leia for Imperial Senate business (and secret Rebel espionage). Captured by the Devastator over Tatooine.

property.name: FirstBox
property.value: CAPITAL: CORVETTE

property.name: GameText
property.value: May be deployed even without presence or Force icons. May add 3 pilots and 4 passengers. Has ship-docking capability. Permanent pilot provides ability of 2.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: 'You would prefer another target? A military target? Then name the system!'

property.name: FirstBox
property.value: UTINNI EFFECT

property.name: GameText
property.value: Once per game, use 2 Force to deploy on Dantooine. Target Death Star. Opponent may not play Commence Primary Ignition until target reaches Dantooine, canceling Utinni Effect.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Piloted Gold 2 as defensive cover for Gold Leader during attack run in Death Star trench at the Battle of Yavin.

property.name: GameText
property.value: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. When piloting Gold 2, also adds 1 to maneuver and (when in Death Star: Trench) adds 1 to total of Attack Run.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: This male Brizzit, from the planet Jandoon, is hiding from the Imperials on the remote world Tatooine. He hopes to procure passage to the Outer Rim before the Empire finds him.

property.name: GameText
property.value: May 'fly' (move) only during your deploy phase, up to two sites away, for 1 Force. Power +1 at Trash Compactor, any Dagobah site or same site as Dark Waters or Tarkin.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Alliance Intelligence expends considerable resources to infiltrate the Imperial military bureaucracy, but the ISB's security sweeps make these shadowy operations dangerous.

property.name: GameText
property.value: Deploy on your spy at a site and cross spy to opponent's side. Spy is now Undercover. During your deploy phase, may voluntarily 'break cover' (lose Effect) if at a site. (Immune to Alter.)

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Highly decorated Corellian. Piloted Red 2 at the Battle of Yavin. A wealthy orphan, he bought a freighter with his inheritance. First joined the Alliance as a weapons smuggler.

property.name: GameText
property.value: Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots. When piloting Red 2, also adds 2 to maneuver and draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise. May use 1 Force to take one Corellian Slip into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.

card.name: ***What're You Tryin' To Push On Us?

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: FirstBox
property.value: IMMEDIATE EFFECT

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: FirstBox
property.value: LOST INTERRUPT

property.name: GameText
property.value: If Chewbacca is defending a battle alone at a site, add two battle destiny. OR Use 3 Force to take Chewie into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. OR Scare off (lose) one 'mouse' droid on table.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: The Rebel Alliance deploys starfighters in triangular formations to minimize exposure to enemy fire. Two function as wingmen to cover one leader.

property.name: FirstBox
property.value: SQUADRON: Y-WING

property.name: GameText
property.value: * Replaces 3 Y-wings at one location (Y-wings go to Used Pile). May add 3 pilots or passengers. Permanent pilots provide total ability of 3.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: DarkLocationText
property.value: If you control, Force drain +1 here and subtract 1 from total of Attack Run.

property.name: LightLocationText
property.value: If you control, with a leader here, may add 1 to total of Attack Run.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: DarkLocationText
property.value: If you control, Force drain +1 here.

property.name: LightLocationText
property.value: If you control, with a leader here, your starships are each power +1 at Death Star System.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: 'Now let's blow this thing and go home!'

property.name: FirstBox
property.value: USED INTERRUPT

property.name: GameText
property.value: Cancel I'm On The Leader. (Immune to Sense.) OR Use 1 Force during an Attack Run. Move one TIE in Death Star: Trench (your choice) to Death Star system for free. Add 1 to total of Attack Run if lead starfighter has matching pilot aboard.

property.name: Expansion
property.value: A New Hope

property.name: Lore
property.value: Snivvian also known as 'Snaggletooth.' A tortured artist who, like most Snivvians, is driven to live out the stories he creates.

property.name: GameText
property.value: Where present, just before opponent draws battle destiny, you may use 1 Force to reduce opponent's total battle destiny by 1.
